intro: Impatiens yercaudensis, commonly known as the Yercaud impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, delicate flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Impatiens yercaudensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
